metadata.title: CVE-2021-33034 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.12.4, net/bluetooth/hci_event.c has ause-after-free when destroying an hci_chan, aka CID-5c4c8c954409. Thisleads to writing an arbitrary value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33034` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-lowlatency - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-aws - 4.4.0-1099.104
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.104').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.134~14.04.1').
